head.title: World Briefing | Africa: Malawi: Vice President's Treason Trial Begins

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Africa: Malawi: Vice President's Treason Trial Begins

abstract.p: Malawi Vice President Cassim Chilumpha goes on trial for treason, accused of conspiring to assassinate President Bingu wa Mutharika; Chilumpha says he is being persecuted because he refused to join new political party Mutharika formed after he was elected in 2004 (S)

block.p: Malawi's tumultuous politics crossed another threshold Tuesday as the vice president, Cassim Chilumpha, went on trial for treason, accused of conspiring to assassinate President Bingu wa Mutharika. Mr. Chilumpha says he is being persecuted because he refused to join the new political party Mr. Mutharika formed after he was elected in 2004.
